intro: Lepidaploa chiriquiensis, commonly known as the Chiriquí lepidaploa, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Arecaceae, which includes palms, and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and palmate leaves. The plant typically grows in humid, tropical environments, often in lowland rainforests. It produces small, clustered flowers that are usually yellow or greenish in color. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
